intro: Euphrasia crassiuscula subsp. eglandulosa, commonly known as the glandless eyebright, is a low-growing perennial herb native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers with prominent yellow markings. The plant typically has hairy stems and oval-shaped leaves that are arranged oppositely along the stem. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along stream banks. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been used historically in traditional herbal remedies.
